channel.title: Git on Coding notes
channel.description: Recent content in Git on Coding notes

item.title: Git go to previous commit
item.description: Check last commits git log --oneline -n <N> Get previous commit locally, WITHOUT modifying HEAD. git checkout <commit-hash> -- . Updates all files in the current directory and subdirectories to match the specified commit. HEAD stays on your current branch â€” you’re not switching commits or branches. Only the working directory is affected, not your branch pointer. Without -- ., git checks out the entire commit and puts you in a detached HEAD state.

item.title: Git force dev into master from PR
item.description: 1. Start from master git checkout master git pull origin master 2. Create new branch from master git checkout -b replace-master-with-dev 3. Reset this branch to have dev’s exact content (but keep master as parent) git reset --soft origin/dev 4. Stage all changes git add -A 5. Commit with a clear message git commit -m "Sync master with dev - replace all content" 6. Push git push origin replace-master-with-dev 7. Create PR in Azure DevOps from replace-master-with-dev to master 8.

item.title: Git stash - and patch
item.description: Stash git stash list # create or save stash git stash # or git stash push -m "description" # Apply latest Stash stash@{0} git stash apply # or git stash apply [INDEX] # Pop - Apply and Remove the latest stash: git stash pop # Drop Stash: git stash drop [INDEX] Stashes can’t be managed by name. A way to do so (like light solution for saving specific changes for specific build config), save pending changes to a file

item.title: Git - forget a file and ignore
item.description: Ignore .gitignore will prevent untracked files from being added (without an add -f) to the set of files tracked by Git. However, Git will continue to track any files that are already being tracked. To stop tracking a file, we must remove it from the index: git rm --cached <file> To remove a folder and all files in the folder recursively: git rm -r --cached <folder> The removal of the file from the head revision will happen on the next commit.

item.title: Git push from script
item.description: Push to github from script mkdir -p ~/.ssh echo "${{ secrets.GITHUB_SSH_PRIVATE_KEY}}" > ~/.ssh/id_rsa chmod 600 ~/.ssh/id_rsa git push git@github.com:bustroker/bkr.hobies.web.git

item.title: Git sparse-checkout
item.description: To checkout and work only with a subset/subtree of folders from a repo (yes, some people insist in economizing repos) Initialize sparse-checkout config git clone URL --no-checkout # add `--depth 1` to only include latest commit from all commit history cd REPO_ROOT git sparse-checkout init --cone # `--cone` to include root files git checkout Set existing folders to be actually checked out git sparse-checkout add Apps/OtherApp # to add new folders to the current checkout list.
